channel.title: Please need help with connecting :s
channel.description:
I honestly don't know where im going wrong. I used to be able to host server's just fine and now it's like everything i go back and try doesn't work! I've reconfigured my router, got no-ip over again, and even tried all these step's on 2 other computer's! Someone please help. I've currently got jdk 1.6.0_16 if that's got anything to do with it. i can connect though my own server but not through the no-ip name. I'm lost :\. Any help with be much appreciated. Thanks!
~th3 w01f~

item.title: Please need help with connecting :s
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Yes. I’m saying that. Only you would use the localhost, while other players would conenct through no-ip. Also, if they’re not connecting, try disabling your firewall, or adding exceptions to the port.

Read full topic

item.title: Please need help with connecting :s
item.dc:creator: @th3_w01f th3 w01f
item.description:
@th3_w01f wrote:

Okay, but though localhost or 127.0.0.1 how would that help me connect my no-ip working? i can connect through 127.0.0.1 but not through no-ip :s[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 04, 2009, 03:47:16 pm[/size][hr]Ohhh wait, mate are you saying i use the 127.0.0.1 while the player’s use the no-ip? and even so the no-ip is not letting people through. i’ve portforwarded already. im lost tbh. i haven’t had trouble up until now.

Read full topic

item.title: Please need help with connecting :s
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Only the players connect through the no-ip. The actual server hoster would conenct using localhost, or 127.0.0.1, both are the same though.

Read full topic
